law.catch_line: Exemption From Excise Under Sec. 39 For Certain Business Corporations

text.section: a financial institution, as defined in section 1, that is subject to excise under section 2 or 2B;
a security corporation as defined in section 38B and subject to excise under that section;
a utility corporation as defined in section 52A and subject to excise under that section;
an insurance company subject to excise under sections 20 to 29E, inclusive;
an urban redevelopment corporation subject to excise under section 10 of chapter 121A;
a corporation described in section 10 or section 18 of chapter 157;
a corporation described in section 1 of chapter 171;
a corporation or other entity that qualifies as a regulated investment company under section 851 of the Code; or

an unincorporated entity within the definition of, and electing to be treated as, a homeownersâ€™ association under section 528(c) of the Code and subject to tax for the taxable year as provided in section 5C of chapter 62; or
a business corporation otherwise expressly exempted from the excise under this chapter by any other general law.
